title: Matcha Latte
steps: Sift the matcha powder into a small bowl to remove lumps.
Add hot water (not boiling) to the matcha and whisk with a bamboo whisk or a small frother until smooth and frothy.
Stir in honey or maple syrup to sweeten, adjusting to your taste
Add vanilla extract, cinnamon, and a pinch of salt to the matcha mixture and stir until fully combined.
In a small saucepan, heat the milk and coconut milk together over medium heat until hot but not boiling.
Pour the warm matcha mixture into a mug.
Slowly pour the frothed milk into the mug over the matcha.
Gently stir to combine or leave it layered for a more aesthetic look.

title: Pancakes
steps: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg, and melted butter.
Add the vanilla extract and mix until smooth.
Preheat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using about 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Brown on both sides and cook until bubbles form and edges are dry.
Flip the pancake and cook the other side until golden brown.
Serve hot with your favorite toppings like syrup, fruit, or butter.

title: Chicken Bowl
steps: Season sliced chicken with olive oil, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and cook chicken until fully cooked, about 6–8 minutes.
While the chicken cooks, prepare your jasmine rice according to package instructions.
Steam broccoli until tender, about 4–5 minutes.
Shred or julienne carrots if not pre-shredded.
Assemble bowls by placing rice at the bottom.
Top rice with cooked chicken, broccoli, and carrots.
Drizzle with teriyaki sauce and serve warm.

title: Cookies
steps: Preheat your oven to 175°C (350°F).
In a bowl, cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in the egg and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, mix flour and baking soda.
Gradually blend the dry ingredients into the wet mixture.
Fold in the chocolate chips evenly.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 10–12 minutes or until edges are golden, then cool on a rack.

title: Carrot Rice
ingredients: 1 cup cooked white or brown rice
steps: Cook the rice according to package instructions and let it cool.
Grate the carrots and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked rice and grated carrots.
Add the chopped parsley to the bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the rice and carrot mixture.
Toss everything together until evenly combined.
Top with toasted almonds before serving.

title: Blueberry Pie
ingredients: 1 tablespoon butter, cut into small pieces
steps: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
In a bowl, mix blueberries, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, and cinnamon.
Unroll one pie crust into a 9-inch pie pan and press it into the bottom.
Pour the blueberry mixture into the crust and dot with butter.
Place the second crust over the filling and crimp the edges to seal.
Cut small slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape.
Brush the top crust with the beaten egg for a golden finish.
Bake for 40–45 minutes, until the crust is golden and filling is bubbly.

title: Egg&Shrimp Noodles
steps: Cook egg noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.
Add garlic and shrimp, stir-fry for 2–3 minutes until shrimp turn pink.
Push shrimp to the side and pour in beaten eggs, scrambling until just set.
Add cooked noodles to the pan and toss everything together.
Pour in soy sauce and sesame oil, mixing well to coat the noodles evenly.
Cook for another 2–3 minutes, stirring frequently.
Top with chopped green onions and serve hot.

title: Flower Mochi
ingredients: A few drops of vanilla or rose extract (optional)
steps: In a microwave-safe bowl, mix glutinous rice flour, water, and sugar until smooth.
Add food coloring and extract if desired, then stir to combine.
Microwave on high for 1 minute, stir, then repeat in 30-second intervals until the dough becomes thick and translucent.
Dust a clean surface with cornstarch or potato starch and transfer the mochi dough onto it.
Let it cool slightly, then divide into small pieces.
Flatten each piece into a circle and place a small spoonful of red bean paste in the center.
Pinch the edges together to seal and form into a round shape.
Optionally, press edible flower petals onto the top for decoration and chill before serving.

title: Fried Chicken
steps: Place chicken pieces in a bowl and cover with buttermilk. Marinate in the fridge for at least 2 hours or overnight.
In another bowl, mix flour with salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
Remove chicken from buttermilk, letting excess drip off.
Coat each piece of chicken thoroughly in the seasoned flour.
Heat oil in a deep pan to 175°C (350°F).
Fry chicken in batches without overcrowding the pan.
Cook for 10–15 minutes, turning occasionally, until golden brown and cooked through.
Drain on a wire rack or paper towels before serving.

title: Kimchi
steps: Cut the napa cabbage into quarters and then into bite-sized pieces.
Dissolve salt in water and soak the cabbage pieces for 1–2 hours, tossing occasionally.
Rinse the cabbage under cold water and drain well.
In a bowl, mix garlic, ginger, sugar, fish sauce, and red pepper flakes to form a paste.
Combine the cabbage with the spice paste and massage it in until fully coated.
Pack the mixture tightly into a clean jar or container.
Leave at room temperature for 1–2 days to ferment slightly, then refrigerate.
Kimchi is ready after a few days in the fridge and continues to develop flavor.

title: Matcha Original
ingredients: 2 ounces hot water (not boiling, about 80°C or 175°F)
Optional: 1/4 cup steamed milk for latte
steps: Sift the matcha powder into a small bowl to remove clumps.
Add a small amount of hot water and whisk into a smooth paste using a bamboo whisk (chasen) or small regular whisk.
Add the remaining hot water while whisking briskly in a zigzag motion until frothy.
Optional: Stir in honey or sweetener if desired.
Optional: Add steamed milk to make a matcha latte.
Serve immediately in a tea bowl or cup.
Enjoy while warm for best flavor.
Clean your whisk with warm water and let it air dry.

title: Black Tea
ingredients: 1 teaspoon loose black tea or 1 black tea bag
steps: Bring the water to a boil (around 100°C or 212°F).
Place the tea bag or loose tea in a cup or teapot.
Pour the hot water over the tea.
Let it steep for 3–5 minutes, depending on desired strength.
Remove the tea bag or strain out the loose tea.
Add sugar or honey if desired.
Add milk or lemon for variation, but not both together.
Stir and enjoy warm.

title: Watermellon Drink
ingredients: 1/2 cup sparkling water or soda water
steps: Place watermelon cubes in a blender and blend until smooth.
Strain the juice through a fine sieve to remove pulp (optional).
Add lime juice and honey to the watermelon juice and stir well.
Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour the watermelon mixture into the glass until 3/4 full.
Top with sparkling water and stir gently.
Garnish with mint leaves and a lime slice.
Serve immediately and enjoy chilled.

title: Matcha Mochi
ingredients: Sweet red bean paste (anko) or white bean paste, for filling
steps: In a bowl, whisk together mochiko, matcha powder, sugar, and salt.
Add water and vanilla extract (if using) and mix until smooth.
Pour the mixture into a microwave-safe bowl and cover loosely with plastic wrap.
Microwave on high for 1 minute, stir, then microwave for 1 more minute.
Stir again and microwave for 30 seconds to 1 minute until the dough becomes translucent and sticky.
Dust a clean surface with starch and transfer the mochi dough onto it.
Divide the dough into 8 pieces and flatten each one into a disk.
Place a small spoonful of bean paste in the center, pinch to seal, and shape into balls. Dust with more starch to prevent sticking.

title: Matcha Rolls
steps: In a small bowl, dissolve the yeast in warm milk and let sit for 5–10 minutes until foamy.
In a large bowl, combine flour, matcha powder, sugar, and salt.
Add the yeast mixture, softened butter, and egg to the dry ingredients. Mix until a dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 8–10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover, and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough, then roll it into a rectangle. Roll up tightly and slice into 8 equal rolls.
Place rolls in a greased baking dish, cover, and let rise again for 30 minutes.
Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 20–25 minutes, until golden brown. Let cool slightly before serving.

title: Tomato Noodles
steps: Cook the noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add garlic and onion, sauté until fragrant and translucent.
Stir in the diced tomatoes and cook for 5–7 minutes until soft.
Add tomato paste and sugar, mix well.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Let simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the cooked noodles to the sauce and toss to coat evenly.
Serve warm, optionally garnished with fresh basil or parmesan.

title: Chicken Noodles
steps: Cook the egg noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the sliced chicken and stir-fry until fully cooked, about 5–6 minutes.
Toss in the carrot and cabbage, stir-frying for another 2–3 minutes.
Add the cooked noodles to the pan.
Pour in the soy sauce and oyster sauce, and toss everything together until well coated and heated through.
Serve hot, optionally garnished with green onions or sesame seeds.

title: Vegetable Noodles
ingredients: 1 tablespoon sesame oil or vegetable oil
steps: Cook the noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and onion, sauté for 2 minutes until soft and fragrant.
Add carrot, bell pepper, and cabbage. Stir-fry for 4–5 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Add the cooked noodles to the pan.
Pour in the soy sauce and toss well to combine everything evenly.
Cook for another 2 minutes, allowing flavors to meld.
Serve warm, optionally topped with chopped green onions or sesame seeds.

title: Onion Soup
steps: Melt butter with olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the sliced onions and sugar. Cook slowly, stirring often, until golden and caramelized (about 25–30 minutes).
Sprinkle in the flour and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Gradually stir in the broth and wine (if using), scraping up any browned bits.
Bring to a simmer and let cook for 20 minutes to blend flavors.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with toasted bread or melted cheese on top if desired.
Garnish with fresh thyme or parsley if available.

title: Poke Bowl
steps: Rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the rice with 1 1/4 cups water according to package instructions.
While the rice is cooking, prepare the tuna or salmon by cubing it into bite-sized pieces.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, and honey to make a dressing.
Once the rice is cooked, let it cool slightly, then divide it into bowls.
Top the rice with the cubed fish, cucumber, avocado, shredded carrots, and green onions.
Drizzle the dressing over the top of the bowl.
Sprinkle sesame seeds and garnish with pickled ginger, if desired.

title: Salmon Bowl
steps: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Place the salmon fillet on a baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil, and bake for about 12-15 minutes or until cooked through.
While the salmon is baking, cook the quinoa or rice according to package instructions.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, sesame oil, and honey to make a dressing.
Once the salmon is cooked, remove from the oven and break it into pieces using a fork.
In bowls, layer the cooked quinoa or rice, then top with the flaked salmon, cucumber, avocado, and shredded carrots.
Drizzle the dressing over the top of the bowl.
Sprinkle sesame seeds, green onions, and garnish with pickled ginger, if desired.

title: Egg Ramen
steps: In a large pot, bring the chicken or vegetable broth to a boil.
Add the soy sauce, miso paste (if using), and sesame oil to the broth, and stir to combine.
Once the broth is simmering, add the ramen noodles and cook according to the package instructions (usually 3-4 minutes).
While the noodles cook, soft-boil the eggs: gently place them in boiling water for 6-7 minutes, then transfer to an ice bath to stop the cooking.
Slice the green onions and mushrooms and set them aside.
Once the noodles are ready, add the spinach or bok choy to the pot and let it wilt for about 1 minute.
Divide the cooked noodles and broth into bowls.
Peel the soft-boiled eggs, cut them in half, and place them on top of the ramen. Garnish with green onions, mushrooms, sesame seeds, and serve.

title: Lemon Ramen
steps: In a pot, bring the vegetable broth to a boil.
Add the soy sauce, sesame oil, lemon juice, and grated lemon zest, stirring to combine.
Once the broth is simmering, add the ramen noodles and cook according to the package instructions (usually 3-4 minutes).
While the noodles cook, prepare the cucumber and green onions, slicing them thinly.
After the noodles are cooked, add the spinach or bok choy to the pot and cook for another 1-2 minutes until wilted.
Divide the cooked noodles and broth into bowls.
Top the ramen with the sliced cucumber, green onions, and sesame seeds.
Serve hot with extra lemon wedges for garnish and added lemony flavor.

title: Rice Original
steps: Rinse the rice under cold water to remove excess starch.
In a medium saucepan, combine the rice, water, and salt.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat.
Once it reaches a boil, reduce the heat to low and cover the pan with a lid.
Simmer the rice for 18-20 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender.
Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it sit, covered, for 5 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork to separate the grains.
If desired, stir in the butter for extra flavor before serving.

title: Vegetable Salad
steps: In a large bowl, combine the cherry tomatoes, cucumber, grated carrot, red onion, and bell pepper.
Add the mixed greens to the bowl and toss the vegetables together.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, honey (if using), salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat all the ingredients evenly.
Taste and adjust the seasoning with more salt, pepper, or lemon juice if needed.
Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator for 15-30 minutes before serving for a refreshing salad.
Optionally, add some crumbled feta or nuts on top for extra texture and flavor.

title: Pink Salad
steps: In a large bowl, combine the cooked beets, quinoa, sliced strawberries, and red onion.
Add the mixed greens and toss gently to combine.
Sprinkle the crumbled goat cheese over the top of the salad.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, honey, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Taste and adjust the seasoning if needed with more salt, pepper, or balsamic vinegar.
Serve immediately or chill for 15 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Garnish with extra strawberries or herbs if desired.

title: Strawberry Shortcake
steps: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Mix dry ingredients together.
Cut in butter until crumbly.
Add egg and milk, mix until just combined.
Pour batter into baking dish and bake 25-30 mins.
Cool, top with strawberries and whipped cream.

title: Avocado Sushi
steps: Rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the rice according to package instructions, using 1 1/4 cups of water.
Once the rice is cooked, mix the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl until dissolved.
Stir the vinegar mixture into the cooked rice and let it cool to room temperature.
Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat, shiny side down.
Evenly spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving a small margin at the top.
Place a few slices of avocado along the center of the rice.
Carefully roll the sushi using the bamboo mat, applying gentle pressure.
Seal the roll by wetting the top edge of the nori with a bit of water.
Slice the sushi into bite-sized pieces and serve with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi.

title: Cucumber Sushi
steps: Rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the rice according to package instructions, using 1 1/4 cups of water.
Once the rice is cooked, mix the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl until dissolved.
Stir the vinegar mixture into the cooked rice and let it cool to room temperature.
Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat, shiny side down.
Evenly spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving a small margin at the top.
Place a few slices of cucumber along the center of the rice.
Carefully roll the sushi using the bamboo mat, applying gentle pressure.
Seal the roll by wetting the top edge of the nori with a bit of water.
Slice the sushi into bite-sized pieces and serve with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi.

title: Fried Sushi
ingredients: 1/2 cup crab sticks or cooked shrimp (optional)
steps: Rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the rice according to package instructions, using 2 1/2 cups of water.
Once the rice is cooked, mix the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl until dissolved.
Stir the vinegar mixture into the cooked rice and let it cool to room temperature.
Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat, shiny side down.
Spread a thin layer of rice evenly over the nori, leaving a small margin at the top.
Add cucumber, avocado, and crab sticks or shrimp along the center of the rice.
Carefully roll the sushi tightly, sealing the edge with a bit of water.
Once the sushi roll is complete, slice it into bite-sized pieces.
Dip each sushi piece into the beaten egg and coat with panko breadcrumbs.
Heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat and fry the sushi pieces until golden and crispy, about 2-3 minutes on each side.
Drain the fried sushi on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Serve with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi.

title: Salmon Sushi
steps: Rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the rice according to package instructions, using 2 1/2 cups of water.
Once the rice is cooked, mix the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl until dissolved.
Stir the vinegar mixture into the cooked rice and let it cool to room temperature.
Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat, shiny side down.
Spread a thin layer of rice evenly over the nori, leaving a small margin at the top.
Place thin slices of fresh salmon, cucumber, and avocado along the center of the rice.
Carefully roll the sushi tightly, sealing the edge with a bit of water.
Once the sushi roll is complete, slice it into bite-sized pieces.
Serve the salmon sushi with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi on the side.

title: Japanese Cookies
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter and powdered sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the egg yolk and vanilla extract, mixing until combined.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, matcha powder, salt, and cornstarch.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, stirring until a dough forms.
Roll the dough into small balls, about 1-inch in diameter, and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
Gently press each cookie with the back of a fork or your fingers to flatten them slightly.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet before transferring to a wire rack.
